Intro Switching to a Saturday Blog!
I’ve decided to change my weekly blog from Friday to Saturday, simply because that’s what has been happening naturally for a while now.
Today’s blog is one of the possible answers to the question I asked last week: What Is the Point of Living?
Healing Through Philosophy - التداوي بالفلسفة This book was a recommendation from an influencer I follow. Interestingly, when I studied Philosophy in university, I didn’t enjoy it much and barely remember what it was about. So, before even starting this book, I was skeptical.
I was actually searching for another book, but since I couldn’t find it in PDF format, I decided to give Healing Through Philosophy (التداوي بالفلسفة) a try. I had time to read while waiting for my brother at the dentist. T_T
📖 Note: The book is in Arabic (my native language). I’m not sure if it’s available in English or other languages.
The author, Saeed Nashid, did an amazing job using his own insights combined with ideas from notable philosophers.
The Chapter That Got Me: “Maybe We Don’t Need Hope”
In this chapter, Nashid references a story from The Book of Samuel II (Old Testament) about Prophet David and how he reacted when his son (before Solomon) was ill and later died. His followers were surprised by his shift in emotions—from distress to calmness. He explained that once his son passed away, he no longer had to witness his suffering. Instead, he found comfort in knowing that he would reunite with him in the afterlife.
The philosophical idea here is how hope can be a double-edged sword—it can motivate us, but it can also cause emotional suffering when things don’t turn out as we expect.
The book also references Jean-Jacques Rousseau, Friedrich Nietzsche, and Baruch Spinoza. Nietzsche, for example, pointed out that the ancient Greeks believed hope was the greatest evil—because it keeps people waiting instead of acting.
My Thoughts on Hope
This chapter hit me because nowadays, “hope” is marketed everywhere—in self-help books, social media, and even corporate culture.
But in reality, hope alone is not enough. Life isn’t a movie where everything magically works out. Most of our days are filled with routine, boredom, and occasional happiness—and too much hope can lead to disappointment when things don’t happen as expected.
Conclusion This book gave me one possible answer to last week’s question. It presents a lifestyle perspective, where people try to define meaning in every aspect of life—whether it’s happiness, career, love, or marriage.
It also helped me understand how ideas evolve over time—how people in the past thought vs. how modern society thinks today.
But here’s my struggle: There are so many concepts in philosophy, and after understanding them, I have to decide how to apply them in my own life.
The book is short—so if you find it in your language, I highly recommend reading it!
Until next week, just take it easy. 😊

title: What’s the Point of Living?" – A Follow-up with Philosophy

content:
Intro I couldn’t write a blog last week because I was under the weather, struggling with seasonal flu. It wasn’t pleasant at all. I keep wondering—why does this happen? When I was younger and living in a different geographic location, I never experienced this.
But after moving to a new place, it started happening, and each time, it hit me hard. For years, I made sure to get a flu shot annually. However, last year, I thought, let me skip it and see what happens. Well, turns out, I couldn’t handle it. So, on Tuesday, I finally got the flu shot, and I’ve been feeling much better in the past couple of days.
That was my little update, but now, let’s get into the real topic of this blog—something that’s been on my mind.
What Is the Point Of Living? or Having a Life? I don’t know why, but this question keeps looping in my mind, especially when I’m sick. 😅
I still remember the first time it struck me—it was in my last year of high school. I kept thinking, No matter how long you live or how much you try to achieve, eventually, you’ll end up in the grave. So what’s the point?
Maybe I was feeling down at the time because my educational path wasn’t clear. But even now, after finishing university, I still ask myself the same question. Sure, completing my degree made me happy, but did it dramatically change my life? Not really. It gave me some direction, like my goal to study abroad, but even if that doesn’t happen, life will just keep moving forward.
Let’s look at it from another angle—marriage or work. We chase after them, but once we have them, they come with their own struggles. Being single or a freelancer isn’t necessarily easier; you become your own judge and prisoner to your thoughts.
Even having dreams and goals can feel heavy. When they don’t work out, you feel crushed. And when they do, sometimes they don’t bring the satisfaction you expected. So, what’s the point? Life will go on, no matter what.
So!!! What is what matters for reall?
Honestly? I don’t know. Some say it’s about the emotions you experience—they change you. But even if you change, life itself doesn’t care.
Conclusion Before anyone worries—no, I don’t have any intentions of ending my life, nor do I have any known mental health issues. I’m just asking a question that I think many people ask themselves at some point.
I’m not looking for an answer, because honestly, anyone who claims to have one is probably lying. Instead, I think the real challenge is finding a way to keep moving forward while still trying to make sense of everything.
For now, let’s just take it easy—until next time. ✌️

Intro When I start thinking about what to write for this week’s blog post, all ideas seem to run away, leaving me with an empty head and struggling to think.
…
Let me just talk about what I found fascinating this week!
Artificial Intelligence (AI) Marketing as a field of study. 🤩
Overview You know that feeling when you’re searching for something you genuinely enjoy? Well, I finally found it! I’ve been on a mission to discover a field that combines AI and Marketing, specifically Digital Marketing, and I came across it at Busan University of Foreign Studies – Artificial Intelligence Marketing.
I found this gem while browsing the university’s overview PDF, and let me tell you—I was beyond excited! 😳
This field brings together everything I enjoy: AI, Languages, and Marketing.
While working in social media marketing, I often used AI for content creation, and honestly, it was a game-changer! Crafting the right prompts, experimenting with AI-generated content, and refining strategies with my team was such an engaging process.
We would share prompts, analyze AI-generated responses, and study different resources to improve our results. The collaboration was amazing!
But There Was a Downside…
The AI sometimes started acting different. 😅 Maybe it was because I wasn’t using the paid version, or perhaps my prompts weren’t structured well! IDK for real.
At times, the AI-generated content felt repetitive, overly philosophical, or too academic—which isn’t ideal for social media marketing. Here’s why:
Social media platforms cater to everyone—from highly educated professionals to casual users. Our job as marketers is to deliver clear, engaging, and easy-to-understand content that drives action.
If our writing is too complex, or if our graphics/videos are overloaded with information, they won’t work—except maybe for Japanese audiences (check the link to know why 🧐). And I want to really use their way of desgining, I’ll share when I’ll use it and how sometime soon.
The point is: Keep it simple, clear, and engaging.
Why I Like It? So, why do I find this field so exciting? Here are my reasons:
1️⃣ It feels like I’m training something < I don’t think I can call it device the AI> the language of how to understand & communicate better.
2️⃣ Languages fascinate me! I recently heard someone point out something interesting which I know but was not present in my mind: English assigns (She/He when talking about Woman/Man), just like Japanese and Arabic, but Urdu doesn’t “آپ (Ap)” is used for both genders! 🤯 I beleive there are other languages, I’ll check it.
3️⃣ I already have experience in digital marketing, so I know this field would be amazing to study!
I also checked out the course curriculum, and it’s exactly what I’ve been looking for! There’s “Introduction to AI Marketing” and “Digital Platform Marketing.” The first one, in particular, has me hooked!
Not to mention, training AI to understand different languages and cultural nuances sounds like an incredible challenge!
Conclusion To sum up, I’m applying to Busan University of Foreign Studies – Artificial Intelligence Marketing, and I’ll be looking for similar programs in other universities as well.
And until I get accepted into one, I plan to experiment with AI to train it in the Urdu language and of course, I’ll share everything here.!
Till then, take it easy! ✌️

Intro After the background of How Anime Inspired My Passion for the Japanese Language. In this blog post, I’ll share the resources that helped me learn the Japanese language for the self-study method.
At the end of this blog post, I’ll share my N5 test result… I got the result today morning 31 Jan 2025. And why I am doing the JLPT exam.
Resourses to help study Japanese: Actually, as I begin to check what are the best resources for self-study or is good to just find a course online or attend a language course at a campus.
I’ll start with the latter since the first takes a lot to explain:
For face-to-face campus: There is an amazing university called NUML University, this uni specializes in Languages there are almost all languages that a person interested in can learn, and they provide various levels starting with certificates to diplomas also, some have Bachelor’s degrees and few have Master Degree. But first, check their website to know more.
But when it came to me, their times were not suitable for me because I was working. So, I said let me try self-study.
Self Study: I did my first online course for Japanese Language I did Marugoto for a while. Eventually, I decided last year in July that I would do the JLPT Exam, yet I was confused between N5 and N4 since N3 I felt there was a lot on me. In the end, my decision was N5.
So, I have missed the date for July 2024. I had to wait and apply for the Des 2024 Test. This gives me like 6 months to really prepare for the first time. I planned to check some videos on Youtube by people who have taken the exam, to create my plan:
Find a Study Book, I have picked from the two famous books Ginki and Mina no Nihon Go the latter. The Study book had everything but, I have put all the required Kanji for N5 in a section in my copy so I can memorize them in my free time, a section for every lesson grammar, and a section for vocabulary with answering book questions.
I have chosen to study for 4 hours but to behonest life won’t relieve you for it grap so when I could not I had to make up time to waste hours. I couldn’t finish the whole book before the exam, I have just finished 5 first lessons.
I did not focus on writing much and speaking since these skills are not tested in the exam, it’s a Muiltbull choice question, for Reading, Grammar, vocabulary, and lastly Listening.
Note You can enhance your skills of speaking and writing if you wish when preparing for the exam but you need to put extra time and effort. I couldn’t because my life experience is different from you all, and I respect it.
Please find the Links to resources in the Links Section I used to help me study the language on my own.
Conclusion Now, after I have given you some brief about my studying plan I still choose learning by myself for my N3 JLPT. My reason for studying Japanese it may sound silly but I want to watch anime without subtitles and as I am trying to find an opportunity to complete my higher studies in Japan, I want to be comfortable with the language.
My result of the 1st Des 2024 Exam as shown, it shows that I did not pass! But considering everything I have mentioned above, I see an achievement and I don’t want to bring the maximum score I want the passing which is 80. Yet, I couldn’t have them this time. Finally, My plan now is to prepare for N3 as I have a whole year to prepare for the exam. And if I did not pass that one I’ll repeat it till I get the passing score.
Just take it easy.

As I remember!😇 After high school I was easily taking my life, cause all I knew back then was that my life hit a dead wall for some reason I will keep off this time, to focus on today’s topic.
It was around 2011 and 2012 or maybe 2013, when I had one main idea in my mind which was how I can develop my language skills. My main focus was the English Language because my mother tongue wasn’t English.😏
To find the resources to help myself find new vocals; there were English songs and TV series! But what was on TV I didn’t like it!🥸 Because the Internet had amazing options like a series called Supernatural, Sam was my favorite! I saw the first of two seasons on TV and when I checked the Internet they were during the 3rd or 4th season, I needed to catch on…😎
Yet, back then I didn’t know anything about torrents!😁 The websites I had were paid to watch not free “I know nothing is supposed to be free for copywrites”. But It’s not me it was away at that time and it was normal at the time. Also, there were some illegal websites for a person like me who could not pay to watch for free….!😮‍💨
The bummer was they did not have American series they had Korean drama, Japanese drama, and Anime!!!!!
Here Is How Everything Started!😳 I began watching first with Korean Drama; Coffee Prince my all-time favorite. Then Boys Before Flowers… and some that I don’t remember now. It helped me gain new words every day cause Korean I wasn’t understand so, I checked the subtitles to know what happening.
This really helped me be good at Reading, Writing, Speaking, and Listening;
Reading: I had to read the subtitles to understand what was happening. Any word I did not know I used to ask my cousin and the early Google translator which use to suck. I don’t remember using a dictionary… hmmm I don’t remember.
Writing: taking up words and writing them on my notes was that was all. And I used to use them in writing on my FB Page, massaging my friends … that was it.
Speaking: I begin using them with my own language! This helped me know how to pronounce it correctly. It got me some laughs on but no worries.
Listening: this was tricky since by listening to Korean a lot I really became familiar with it.
A Brilliant Idea Come-up
Why don’t I start also learning Korean! I’ll hit two birds with one stone since learning languages has become my goal. And I did it and started learning the alphabet and watching. I kept doing this for a while.
Then my friend N ‘‘her name starts with N’’, to avoid any confusion. She told me to watch an anime with her and I did not resist yet, I welcomed the idea. Gosick was the one I began with my friend watching the anime. After that, I am still watching anime. I started loving Japan, Japanese culture, and language.
I Think Ending This Blog Here, Is A Good Idea! This fancy kind of story is here.🤭 I can proudly say that I have passed my IELTS exam with a very pleasant mark and I did my N5 first JLPT exam on Dec 2024; still waiting for the results.
I can have another special blog on My favorite anime, How I prepare for the N5 JLPT exam, and maybe I’ll share my IELTS success story! I may share my own tips for learning languages as self-study.And the best resources that I used from ppl I saw as experts in it.
